title: Child injured in accidental shooting
content:
WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. —
A child was rushed to St. Mary's Medical Center after suffering a gunshot wound in an accidental shooting Friday.
Authorities with the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office said the shooting happened on Australian Avenue near Blue Heron Boulevard in Mangonia Park.
Investigators said the child was alert and talking when he arrived at the hospital about 3 p.m. Officials said he was in stable condition at St. Mary's Medical Center.
Authorities said the children involved are brothers. The child's father said the 7-year-old boy was shot in the face by his 6-year-old sibling.
Authorities said their mother and a younger sister were also in the apartment.
Officials said they believe the shooting was accidental and happened inside an apartment.
Authorities said there were conflicting accounts of where the handgun was when the child found it.
The father told authorities the handgun belongs to him.
The Sheriff's Office said charges could be pending for one or both parents.
